articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il enjoys performance of choir
Secy. Kim Jong Il's birthday celebrated abroad
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il enjoys performance of choir
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed
a performance given by the merited choir of the song and dance
ensemble of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on sunday.
   The performance marked the 50th anniversary of the 
ensemble.
   After enjoying the performance filled with revolutionary 
zeal and militant spirit, Secretary Kim Jong Il expressed 
great satisfaction and congratulated the singers of the 
choir on their successful, inspiring performance that 
reflected the invincible spirit of the heroic KPA.
   Over the past 50 years, the KPA song and dance ensemble 
has conducted energetic and militant art activities in all 
periods and stages of revolution including the Fatherland 
Liberation War as the standard-bearers and trumpeters of the 
struggle and greatly encouraged the army and the people to 
build a new country, defeat the enemy, build socialism and 
implement the party's military line. He showed high 
appreciation for their noble exploits.
   He said the merited choir, which is revolutionary, 
militant and highly artistic, is a great pride of the army 
and the people of Korea.
   He advanced the tasks of the song and dance ensemble, 
urging it to continue to take the lead in arousing the army 
and the people to heroic feats. 
   The audience included director of the KPA General 
Political Department Jo Myong Rok, Chief of the KPA general 
staff Kim Yong Chun and secretaries of the Workers' Party of 
Korea Central Committee Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kuh Thae, Kim Ki 
Nam and Kim Yong Sun.

articles.title: "Society for Solidarity and Unity" formed in N. Korea
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il's birthday celebrated abroad
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The 55th birthday of 
Secretary Kim Jong Il was celebrated by the 
world's progressive people as an auspicious holiday common 
to humankind.
   Preparatory committees for celebrating the day, Feb. 16, 
was organized in many countries.
   In the wake of the appearance of the preparatory 
committee for celebrating the 55th birthday of Secretary 
Kim Jong Il in Denmark on November 18 last year, such 
committees were inaugurated in 45 countries including 
Madagascar, Zimbabwe, Uganda, Russia, Finland, Bangladesh, 
Pakistan, Britain, Mexico and Colombia.
   The Secretariat of the Central Committee of the All-Union 
Communist Party of Bolsheviks adopted a resolution "on 
holding celebrations of Secretary Kim Jong Il's 55th 
birthday", the British Association for 
Friendship with the Korean People issued information calling 
for taking an active part in celebrations of his birthday 
and the Christian Arab Democratic Party of Jordan and the 
Political Executive Committee of the Party for Peace and 
Unity in Russia released statements on the occasion.
   Cambodian King Norodom Sihanouk arranged a grand banquet 
and the national Executive Committee of the Mexican Workers' 
Party gave a reception in celebration of his birthday.
   "Day of Korea", a cultural evening and an art performance 
took place in Nepal, Mongolia and Egypt with attendance of 
senior party and government officials, a February 16 Prize 
Taekwon-do Tournament and a February 16 Prize Table-Tennis 
Tournament were held in Madagascar and Tanzania and joint 
meetings of political parties and organizations convened in 
Russia, Bulgaria, Zaire, Ghana and many other countries.
   Speakers at the meetings praised Secretary Kim Jong Il as 
the great sun of the era of independence and the great 
leader of the 21st century.
   Celebration gatherings and meetings, photo and book 
exhibitions, etc. took place in some sixty countries. The 
events totalled more than 600.
   Gifts and floral baskets were sent to Secretary Kim Jong Il 
by foreign state, government and Party leaders, high-ranking 
officials and organisations, the Guinean and Ugandan 
Presidents and former Portuguese President included.
   Foreign party leaders and senior officials called at 
missions of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, 
congratulating Secretary Kim Jong Il on his birthday.
   Santiago de Cali, Colombia, and Lima, Peru, awarded 
Secretary Kim Jong Il honorary citizenship, trieste, 
Italy, and the Permanent Standing Committee of the Soviet 
Congress of People's Deputies conferred a commemorative 
medal and Marshal Zhukov medal respectively on him.
   Ceremonies of placing portraits of  President Kim Il Sung 
and  Secretary Kim Jong Il were held in Mongolia, Peru and 
Zimbabwe. Meanwhile, some 100 press  media of about 60 
countries published special writeups or articles on 250 
occasions.

articles.title: All-people movement for probe into Hanbo incident vowed in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Society for Solidarity and Unity" formed in N. Korea
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A consultative meeting was 
held here by political parties, public organisations and 
personages from all walks of life including cultural and art 
circles in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
   The meeting called upon the political parties, public 
organisations and individual personages in the 
north, south and abroad to conduct an active solidarity 
movement for national independence and peace, transcending 
differences in ideology, system, ideal and religious belief, 
this year, which has been defined as a year of solidarity of 
the north, south and overseas Koreans for national 
independence and peace.
   The meeting decided to form a "Society for Solidarity 
and Unity" consisting of personages from different public 
circles, out of a desire to actively conduct contact, 
dialogue and solidarity movement between the north and the 
south.
   At the meeting chairman of the Korean Religionists' 
Council Jang Jae Chol was elected chairman of the society 
and vice-chairwoman of the State Education Commission Ryo 
Won Gu and first vice-president of the Academy of Social 
Sciences Kim Chol Sik vice-chairmen of the society and 18 
people members of the society.

articles.title: 50th anniversary of publication of President Kim Il Sung.s work marked
articles.content:
All-people movement for probe into Hanbo incident vowed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A joint conference of 13
civic, social and religious organisations in South Korea, 
including the confederation of trade unions, the citizens 
solidarity for democratic society and the citizens 
federation for economic justice recently declared that an 
all-people movement would be launched for the introduction 
of a special prosecutor system to probe the truth behind the 
hanbo incident and for the enactment of an anti-corruption 
law, a South Korean newspaper reported. 
   The conference said in a statement that the Hanbo 
incident is a downright betrayal of the people's ardent 
desire for democracy and social justice and that Kim Young Sam
is seeking to conclude the incident in a hurry, avoiding a 
thorough investigation of it.
   It demanded the establishment of a special prosecutor 
system for thorough investigation and immediate enactment of 
an anti-corruption law. 
   The conference declared that the organisations will 
demand a special law for the introduction of a special 
prosecutor system in march and wage a demonstration in front 
of the "national assembly hall" till the demand is met.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam group's arrest of S. Korean student under fire
articles.content:
50th anniversary of publication of President Kim Il Sung.s work marked
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held 
in Pyongyang to mark the 50th anniversary of the publication 
of the famous work of the great leader President Kim Il Sung 
"For the Efficient Administration of the State Finances" 
(feb. 28, 1947).
   President Kim Il Sung in the work indicated concrete 
tasks and ways for the efficient administration of the state 
finances. He called for solving the financial problem 
independently without depending on  aid or loans from other 
countries, enforcing strict financial discipline and  
staging a patriotic movement of saving. He urged all 
financial workers to become true servants of the people.
   The work is of historic importance as it opened the way 
of self-reliance in finance for the building of an 
independent state.  It is also an important guide of eternal 
value  and a precious asset that enriches the Juche-oriented 
financial theory.
   Present at the meeting were vice-President Ri Jong Ok, 
member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of 
the Workers' Party of Korea, other senior party and state 
officials and workers of central and local financial organs.
   Yun Ki Jong, Minister of Finance, said in her report 
that President Kim Il Sung advanced the outstanding idea on 
the independent finance for the first time in history. This 
is an immortal exploit conducive to the development of Juche 
socialist financial theory and the revolutionary cause of 
Korea, she said.
   She noted that all the financial workers should hold the 
President in high esteem for all ages as the great sun 
of Juche and exalt his immortal leadership exploits 
in the financial domain.
   The most important task in the financial domain at 
present is to carry out the important tasks put forward by 
Secretary Kim Jong Il in his famous work "On Improving 
Financial and Banking Work" and establish the 
revolutionary habit of implementing the financial policy of 
the Party on the principle of socialist financial 
administration, she stressed.

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Kim Young Sam group's arrest of S. Korean student under fire 
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Municipal 
Student Committee denounced the Kim Young Sam fascist clique 
for arresting the chairperson of the general student council 
of Duksung Women's University of South Korea who is a fourth-
year student of the sociology course of the university on 
February 23.
   She made public a letter sent by the Pyongyang Municipal 
Student Committee to the Seoul District Federation of 
University Student Councils through a wall-paper on the 
notice board of the campus from Jan. 30 to Feb. 9 in the 
name of the national reunification committee of the 
university.
    The committee in a statement on March 10 says the arrest 
shows that the traitor Kim Young Sam would continue to 
mercilessly crack down on the reunification movement of 
South Korean students which will be more vigorously 
conducted this year in which falls the fifth anniversary of 
the formation of the national alliance of youth and students 
for the country's reunification. The statement continues:
   Nothing can justify the challenge to the nationwide 
struggle of the fellow countrymen for an independent and 
peaceful reunification of the country. The challengers will 
be sternly judged by the nation.
   The students in the north and south will never tolerate 
any acts of injustice going against the trend of history but 
deal a heavy blow at them with concerted efforts for justice 
and patriotism.
   The Kim Young Sam must clearly see the trend of 
the time, immediately release the student and pay dearly for 
his crimes against the nation and the youth and student 
movement for national reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Japan's dream of military reinvasion
articles.content:
Press review 
  Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Papers here today 
frontpage a report that Secretary Kim Jong Il, Chairman of the
National Defense Commission of the Democratic People's 
Republic of Korea and Supreme Commander of the Korean People's
Army, enjoyed a performance given by the merited choir of the 
song and dance ensemble of the KPA on Mar. 9 on the occasion 
of the 50th anniversary of the ensemble.
   Rodong Sinmun carries news that Secretary Kim Jong Il sent 
thanks to the Ministry for natural resources development and 
its affiliated units for their discovery of a new cave which 
would help towards the people's cultural life.
   Given in the paper is news about the letters and 
postcards of the Sobaeksu Society in South Jolla Province of 
South Korea which paid homage to Secretary Kim Jong Il on the 
occasion of his birthday. The paper also runs an article 
about foreign poets praising Secretary Kim Jong Il as the 
guardian of the cause of independence and the saviour of 
mankind.
   A national meeting was held to mark the 50th anniversary 
of the publication of the famous work of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung "For the Efficient Administration of 
the State Finances", says the press.
   Rodong Sinmun runs articles telling about the fortune of 
the Korean people blessed with leaders.
   Carried in Minju Joson is reminiscences of Jon Mun Sop, 
an anti-Japanese revolutionary veteran, saying that 
President Kim Il Sung during the whole period of the anti-
Japanese revolutionary struggle paid attention to always 
managing the units substantially.
   Appearing in the press are an account of a conference of 
DPRK political parties, organizations and personages from 
various walks of life, which decided to set up a "Council 
for Solidarity and Unity", and a statement published by the 
Pyongyang Municipal Student Committee in protest against the 
kim Young Sam group's arrest of a patriotic student in South 
Korea. Thirteen civic, public and religious organizations of 
South Korea launched an all-people campaign for probing the 
hanbo loan scandal, reports the press.
   In a commentary Rodong Sinmun brands as a second 
retrogressive revision the "unified labour bill" which was 
"perfectly agreed upon" by the ruling and opposition parties 
of South Korea. 
   The paper also carries a commentary lashing out at the 
Japanese reactionaries' scheme for the "security emergency 
legislative arrangements" and an article entitled "revival 
of nazism must be allowed on no account".

articles.title: Replica of fascist labour law
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Japan's dream of military reinvasion 
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- There are indications that 
Japan is going ahead with the "security emergency 
legislative arrangements" aimed at military reinvasion, says 
Rodong Sinmun in a commentary today. The daily says:
   Recently, Ichiro Ozawa, president of the main opposition 
new frontier party, called for the "emergency legislative 
arrangements" at diet and Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto, 
agreeing with him, stressed the need to study "emergency 
legislation".
   Earlier, chief cabinet secretary Seiroku Kajiyama, who is 
the government spokesman and also senior aide to the Prime 
Minister, made the same call allegedly to "cope with 
emergency in the Korean Peninsula".
  The facts show that the "emergency legislative 
arrangements" are an important part of the Japanese 
militarists' scheme for reinvasion.
   What the Japanese reactionaries seek is to have a legal 
and institutional mechanism for military aggression with a 
fiction of "emergency", contain the factors unfavorable to 
their policy of aggression and launch a full-dress 
reinvasion with the mobilization of huge human, material and 
military potentials.
   The "legislative arrangements" by the Japanese 
reactionary ruling circles is, in the final analysis, aimed 
at the reinvasion of Korea.
   It is as good as suicide bringing Japan, which boasts of 
being an economic power, to ruin.
   The Japanese reactionaries had better take a cool view of 
the situation and ponder over their scheme.

articles.title: "Paco" piano enjoying popularity
articles.content:
Replica of fascist labour law 
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a 
commentary today brands a "single proposal of labour law" 
which reached a "full agreement" between the South Korean 
ruling and opposition parties as a "second retrogressive 
revision" which is little different from the "labour law" 
railroaded by the puppets late last year.
   The daily says:
   the Kim Young Sam group worked out a fascist labour law 
again through political bargaining with opposition parties. 
This is an unpardonable challenge and an intolerable crime 
against the South Korean workers and other people demanding 
a reamendment of the "labour law" to meet the requirement of 
the workers for democracy and suit the international 
standard on the basis of the complete nullification of the 
retrogressively revised "labour law".
   The "reamendment of the labour law" advertized by the Kim 
Young Sam group is nothing but a political bargaining to 
play for time, calm down the spirit of the people fighting 
for the repeal of the evil law, probe into the truth behind 
the Hanbo scandal and punishment of those responsible for 
it, bridge over the prevailing political and economic 
confusion and uneasiness and enforce the original murderous 
fascist law.
   The socalled "negotiation for rewriting labour law" fully 
revealed that the South Korean opposition parties are a 
group of philistines who are trying to enhance their 
"political image" while betraying the rights and interests 
of the workers and making a compromise with the dictators so 
that they can catch fish in troubled water in the 
forthcoming "Presidential election". 
   The South Korean workers and other people, aware that 
struggle is the only way out, will continue to undauntedly 
struggle until their just demand is met, not harbouring any 
illusion about and expectation from the puppet clique and 
the political quacks.

articles.title: Revival of Nazism is intolerable
articles.content:
"Paco" piano enjoying popularity 
  Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Pianos of various types 
are now being produced at the Pyongyang Piano Joint-Venture 
Company.
   Especially, the Paco upright 108, 120 and 130 types are 
very popular. 
   The sounding board is made of old spruce that grows in 
the highlands of Korea.  That is why it is famous for good 
echo, no deformity and loud and beautiful sound.
   The Paco pianos are exported to some 20 countries such as 
Japan, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands and southeast Asian 
countries. They are in increasing demand. 
   The company also produces medium-sized grand pianos of 
high quality as well as ordered ones. 
   Founded in 1989, the company has an annual production 
capacity of 5,000. 
   Secretary  Kim Jong Il sent thanks to the 
company three times for modernizing its production 
processes, increasing its capacity and producing many pianos 
through the development and introduction of new 
technologies.

articles.title: Korean vegetation atlas produced
articles.content:
Revival of Nazism is intolerable 
   Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The revival of Neo-Nazism 
is a grave challenge to the desire of humankind for 
independence, peace and democracy and it can never be 
tolerated. Rodong Sinmun says this in a signed article today.
   The daily notes:
   Though some fifty years has passed since the ruin of the 
advocates of Nazism, it comes to life again in some 
countries. This is an inevitable product of the reactionary 
and unpopular capitalist society.
   Ghosts of Nazism and militarism swagger about in Japan 
particularly. To the consternation of people, voices calling 
for following hitler's example are ringing out from within 
the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan.  
   Former and incombent ministers officially and 
unscrupulously deny or defend the crimes committed by 
fascist Japan in the past,  and ultra right-wing 
organisations and individuals beautify the past wrongdoings. 
And the attempt to make the visit to Yasukuni Shrine an 
official and regular business is connived at. It is as clear 
as noonday that these are moves to repeat the past crimes.
   The revival of Neo-Nazism going against the aspiration of 
the people to build a peaceful and free, new world must 
never be tolerated.
